messages.text: WHAT?!
Shit, I don’t want my roommate to die.
Maybe you were right. Maybe we should call the cops.
But you said you didn’t want him to get locked up!
Yeah, but that was before there was a chance we might kill my best friend!
David, I don’t think the cops are going to believe us if we call them.
I mean, what are we supposed to tell them?
That your roommate turned into a werewolf?
No, we’ll just tell them that our friend is in trouble.
That he isn’t acting like himself and that he’s covered in blood.
Idk, that sounds so messed up.
What if the cops start to think that YOU did something sketchy?
It won’t matter, because I didn’t actually do anything wrong.
It’s not like they can imprison an innocent man.
Um, have you listened to ANY podcasts lately?
Damn it, you’re right.
But you were with me all night. I have an alibi.
Idk, David.
Girlfriends often lie for their boyfriends.
And we haven’t been together for hours.
You even left that note in my apartment to prove it.
That’s pretty damning evidence.
Shit!
I know.
David, let me get the wolfsbane. I’m already at my aunt’s house.
We don’t have to use it, but this way we have it as an option.
Okay. Fine.
Are you still hiding behind the grave?
Yeah. It’s so creepy here.
Everything’s really quiet.
The only thing I can hear is the sound of my breath.
It’s really loud—even to my own ears.
Ugh, that’s horrible. But I’ll be there as soon as I can.
SHIT!
That breathing sound was never coming from me.
It’s Samson.
He’s a few gravestones away.
And even in the shadows, I can see his chest heaving.
David, RUN!!
OMG, I’m freaking out.
I’m imagining him ripping your throat out with those sharp shiny teeth.
I swear to God, his eyes were glowing red tonight.
David?! David, please answer me.
That’s it, I’m calling the cops if I don’t hear from you in five minutes.
four minutes later
Hey—I’m all right. I’m alive.
Thank GOD.
I literally had 911 dialed, and my thumb was hovering over the call button.
Did you lose him?
I think so. I climbed up a tree.
Werewolves can’t climb trees, right?
How am I supposed to know??!
Idk, you’re the Google queen of werewolves!
Yeah, but I don’t think Google has a section on their tree-climbing abilities!
Just stay hidden, babe. Please.
And stop texting me!
I don’t want the glow from your cellphone to lure him closer.
Okay. And Mary?
What?
If this doesn’t work out—if I die tonight—
Shut up. You’re getting through this.
So don’t even finish that sentence.
I’m finishing it anyway, because I love you.
Love you too. And I’ll be seeing you.
Damn, I hope so.
Right after David clicks his phone to sleep mode,
He hears a scratching noise at the base of the tree and a gravelly voice that matches it.
It sounds like his roommate—but at the same time, it doesn’t.
There’s something sinister and dark beneath Samson’s usual timbre.
Don’t play with me, David…
Turning off your cellphone light isn’t going to help you escape me,
Because I can see you perfectly fine.
In fact, let’s make this game fair.
Turn it on. So we can look each other in the eyes.
Scared speechless, David presses the flashlight button on his phone.
Samson’s figure is illuminated below, and it’s more hideous than David perceived.
On a face full of cuts and bruises,
Every one of Samson’s features seems larger in the sterile, eerie glow of light.
David gasps, and struggles to find his voice.
Samson?
Is that really you?
Yeah it’s me, dumbass.
Now are you going to come down here and face me like a man?
Or am I going to have to chase you up there?
David doesn’t answer, and instead climbs higher and higher in the tree.
But suddenly, his body lurches. David looks down,
Where Samson has dug all four of his limbs in the trunk.
Samson starts plodding up the tree, and David slides toward the end of his branch—
Which starts to wobble under his weight. Samson screams.
Give up now, David…
You can’t escape me!
Oh yeah? That’s where you’re wrong.
David closes his eyes, summoning his last bit of bravery,
And lets himself drop from the tree.
He lands—HARD—on the ground, and rolls to the side.
He starts to scurry to his feet when he hears a thud next to him.
Samson has thrown himself off the tree too.
What the hell, man?
With every sentence Samson speaks, he paces closer to David.
You are SUCH an asshole.
Completely selfish.
I wish I’d never met—
STOP!
Back OFF him, you monster! You werewolf!
Both of the guys go completely still,
And then turn their heads toward the sound of her screaming voice.
Mary slams her cab door shut and marches over to them.
But then the clouds shift in the sky,
And the moon gets tucked away from view.
Mary?
Yeah, it’s me. Who do you think it is?
I know, but...what are you doing here?
I asked her to come.
I need help, man.
What?
Samson looks down at his hands.
The blood has dried now, so it’s cracked and caked like red mud.
How did I…What did I…
Never mind.
We’re here to help you. I brought wolfsbane.
Wolfs…what?
Wolfsbane.
Samson? There’s no easy way to tell you this…
But we think you’re a werewolf.
What?
Look at yourself, man.
Your clothes are in tatters. Your hair is completely wild…
Yeah, so?
So we can fix it.
If you have a bite of this wolfsbane you won’t be a werewolf anymore.
Sweetheart…
What David?
Shouldn’t we tell Samson the consequences?
Tell me WHAT consequences?
You could die, man
If you eat too much of it.
You know what?
I don’t fucking care.
I’m so miserable, that life doesn’t even matter anymore.
A beat of silence falls between the three of them
As Mary and David nervously toy with their hands.
Seriously, give that shit to me.
It’ll either stop me from being such a goddamn mess…
From being so ANGRY all the time…
Or it’ll off me.
And I’ll actually get to see my brother again.
David and Mary are still too afraid to speak. They look at each other fearfully,
And Mary starts to slip the wolfsbane in her purse. But then—
Samson lunges forward, ripping the flower out of her grip.
In the same moment that the moon slides back into view,
He pulls off three petals from the top and swallows them whole.
And then they wait…
